verses.verse: Then went <S%H3212><s%> Samson <S%H8123><s%> to Gaza <S%H5804><s%>, and saw <S%H7200><s%> there a prostitute <S%H802><s%>, and went in unto her <S%H935><s%>.

And it was told the Gazites <S%H5841><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Samson <S%H8123><s%> is come <S%H935><s%> here <S%H5437><s%>. And they surrounded him in, and laid wait <S%H693><s%> for him all night <S%H3915><s%> in the gate <S%H8179><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%>, and were quiet <S%H2790><s%> all the night <S%H3915><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, In the morning <S%H1242><s%>, when it is day <S%H216><s%>, we shall kill him <S%H2026><s%>.

And Samson <S%H8123><s%> lay <S%H7901><s%> until midnight <S%H2677><s%>, and arose <S%H6965><s%> at midnight <S%H2677><s%>, and took <S%H270><s%> the doors <S%H1817><s%> of the gate <S%H8179><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%>, and the two <S%H8147><s%> posts <S%H4201><s%>, and went away <S%H5265><s%> with them <S%H1280><s%>, bar and all <S%H7760><s%>, and put them upon his shoulders <S%H3802><s%>, and carried them up <S%H5927><s%> to the top <S%H7218><s%> of a hill <S%H2022><s%> that is before <S%H6440><s%> Hebron <S%H2275><s%>.
And it came to pass afterward <S%H310><s%>, that he loved <S%H157><s%> a woman <S%H802><s%> in the valley <S%H5158><s%> of Sorek <S%H7796><s%>, whose name <S%H8034><s%> was Delilah <S%H1807><s%>.

And the lords <S%H5633><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%> unto her <S%H559><s%>, and said unto her <S%H6601><s%>, Entice him <S%H7200><s%>, and see where his great <S%H1419><s%> strength <S%H3581><s%> lies <S%H3201><s%>, and by what means we may prevail against him <S%H631><s%>, that we may bind him to afflict <S%H6031><s%> him <S%H5414><s%>: and we will give you every one <S%H376><s%> of us eleven hundred <S%H505><s%> pieces of silver <S%H3701><s%>.

And Delilah <S%H1807><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Samson <S%H8123><s%>, Tell <S%H5046><s%> me <S%H1419><s%>, I pray you, where your great strength <S%H3581><s%> lies <S%H631><s%>, and with which you might be bound to afflict you <S%H6031><s%>.

And Samson <S%H8123><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto her <S%H631><s%>, If they bind me with seven <S%H7651><s%> green <S%H3892><s%> cords <S%H3499><s%> that were never dried <S%H2717><s%>, then shall I be weak <S%H2470><s%>, and be as another <S%H259><s%> man <S%H120><s%>.

Then the lords <S%H5633><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> brought up <S%H5927><s%> to her seven <S%H7651><s%> green <S%H3892><s%> cords <S%H3499><s%> which had not been dried <S%H2717><s%>, and she bound him with them <S%H631><s%>.

Now there were men lying in wait <S%H693><s%>, waiting <S%H3427><s%> with her in the chamber <S%H2315><s%>. And she said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H6430><s%>, The Philistines are upon you <S%H8123><s%>, Samson. And he broke <S%H5423><s%> the cords <S%H3499><s%>, as a thread <S%H6616><s%> of flax <S%H5296><s%> is broken <S%H5423><s%> when it touches <S%H7306><s%> the fire <S%H784><s%>. So his strength <S%H3581><s%> was not known <S%H3045><s%>.

And Delilah <S%H1807><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Samson <S%H8123><s%>, Behold <S%H2048><s%>, you have mocked me <S%H1696><s%>, and told me lies <S%H3577><s%>: now tell <S%H5046><s%> me <S%H631><s%>, I pray you, with which you might be bound.

And he said <S%H559><s%> unto her <S%H631><s%>, If they bind me fast <S%H631><s%> with new <S%H2319><s%> ropes <S%H5688><s%> that never were occupied <S%H4399><s%>, then shall I be weak <S%H2470><s%>, and be as another <S%H259><s%> man <S%H120><s%>.

Delilah <S%H1807><s%> therefore took <S%H3947><s%> new <S%H2319><s%> ropes <S%H5688><s%>, and bound <S%H631><s%> him with it <S%H559><s%>, and said unto him <S%H6430><s%>, The Philistines be upon you <S%H8123><s%>, Samson. And there were liers in wait <S%H693><s%>, waiting <S%H3427><s%> in the chamber <S%H2315><s%>. And he broke <S%H5423><s%> them from off his arms <S%H2220><s%> like a thread <S%H2339><s%>.

And Delilah <S%H1807><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto Samson <S%H8123><s%>, Until Now <S%H2008><s%> you have mocked <S%H2048><s%> me <S%H1696><s%>, and told me lies <S%H3577><s%>: tell <S%H5046><s%> me with which you might be bound <S%H631><s%>. And he said <S%H559><s%> unto her <S%H707><s%>, If you weave the seven <S%H7651><s%> locks <S%H4253><s%> of my head <S%H7218><s%> with the web <S%H4545><s%>.

And she fastened <S%H8628><s%> it with the pin <S%H3489><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H6430><s%>, The Philistines be upon you <S%H8123><s%>, Samson. And he awaked <S%H3364><s%> out of his sleep <S%H8142><s%>, and went away <S%H5265><s%> with the pin <S%H3489><s%> of the log <S%H708><s%>, and with the web <S%H4545><s%>.

And she said <S%H559><s%> unto him <S%H349><s%>, How can you say <S%H559><s%>, I love <S%H157><s%> you <S%H3820><s%>, when your heart is not with me <S%H2048><s%>? you have mocked me these three <S%H7969><s%> times <S%H6471><s%>, and have not told <S%H5046><s%> me where your great <S%H1419><s%> strength lies <S%H3581><s%>.

And it came to pass <S%H6693><s%>, when she pressed him daily <S%H3117><s%> with her words <S%H1697><s%>, and urged <S%H509><s%> him <S%H5315><s%>, so that his soul was troubled <S%H7114><s%> unto death <S%H4191><s%>;

That he told <S%H5046><s%> her all his heart <S%H3820><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%> unto her <S%H5927><s%>, There has not come a razor <S%H4177><s%> upon my head <S%H7218><s%>; for I have been a Nazarite <S%H5139><s%> unto God <S%H430><s%> from my mother <S%H517><s%>'s womb <S%H990><s%>: if I be shaven <S%H1548><s%>, then my strength <S%H3581><s%> will go <S%H5493><s%> from me <S%H2470><s%>, and I shall become weak, and be like any other man <S%H120><s%>.

And when Delilah <S%H1807><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> that he had told <S%H5046><s%> her all his heart <S%H3820><s%>, she sent <S%H7971><s%> and called <S%H7121><s%> for the lords <S%H5633><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>, saying <S%H559><s%>, Come up <S%H5927><s%> this once <S%H6471><s%>, for he has showed <S%H5046><s%> me all his heart <S%H3820><s%>. Then the lords <S%H5633><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> came up <S%H5927><s%> unto her <S%H5927><s%>, and brought money <S%H3701><s%> in their hand <S%H3027><s%>.

And she made him sleep <S%H3462><s%> upon her knees <S%H1290><s%>; and she called <S%H7121><s%> for a man <S%H376><s%>, and she caused him to shave off <S%H1548><s%> the seven <S%H7651><s%> locks <S%H4253><s%> of his head <S%H7218><s%>; and she began <S%H2490><s%> to afflict <S%H6031><s%> him <S%H3581><s%>, and his strength went from him <S%H5493><s%>.

And she said <S%H559><s%>, The Philistines <S%H6430><s%> be upon you <S%H8123><s%>, Samson. And he awoke <S%H3364><s%> out of his sleep <S%H8142><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, I will go out <S%H3318><s%> as at other times before <S%H6471><s%>, and shake <S%H5287><s%> myself <S%H3045><s%>. And he knew not that the Lord <S%H3068><s%> was departed from him <S%H5493><s%>.

But the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> took <S%H270><s%> him <S%H5365><s%>, and put out his eyes <S%H5869><s%>, and brought him down <S%H3381><s%> to Gaza <S%H5804><s%>, and bound <S%H631><s%> him with fetters of brass <S%H5178><s%>; and he did grind <S%H2912><s%> in the prison <S%H631><s%> house <S%H1004><s%>.
But the hair <S%H8181><s%> of his head <S%H7218><s%> began <S%H2490><s%> to grow again <S%H6779><s%> after <S%H834><s%> he was shaven <S%H1548><s%>.

Then the lords <S%H5633><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> gathered them together <S%H622><s%> for to offer <S%H2076><s%> a great <S%H1419><s%> sacrifice <S%H2077><s%> unto Dagon <S%H1712><s%> their god <S%H430><s%>, and to rejoice <S%H8057><s%>: for they said <S%H559><s%>, Our god <S%H430><s%> has delivered <S%H5414><s%> Samson <S%H8123><s%> our enemy <S%H341><s%> into our hand <S%H3027><s%>.

And when the people <S%H5971><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> him <S%H1984><s%>, they praised their god <S%H430><s%>: for they said <S%H559><s%>, Our god <S%H430><s%> has delivered <S%H5414><s%> into our hands <S%H3027><s%> our enemy <S%H341><s%>, and the destroyer <S%H2717><s%> of our country <S%H776><s%>, which killed <S%H2491><s%> many of us <S%H7235><s%>.

And it came to pass <S%H3820><s%>, when their hearts were merry <S%H2896><s%>, that they said <S%H559><s%>, Call <S%H7121><s%> for Samson <S%H8123><s%>, that he may make us sport <S%H7832><s%>. And they called <S%H7121><s%> for Samson <S%H8123><s%> out of the prison <S%H631><s%> house <S%H1004><s%>; and he made them <S%H6440><s%> sport <S%H6711><s%>: and they set <S%H5975><s%> him between the pillars <S%H5982><s%>.

And Samson <S%H8123><s%> said <S%H559><s%> unto the lad <S%H5288><s%> that held <S%H2388><s%> him by the hand <S%H3027><s%>, Allow <S%H3240><s%> me to feel <S%H4184><s%> the pillars <S%H5982><s%> whereupon the house <S%H1004><s%> stands <S%H3559><s%>, that I may lean upon them <S%H8172><s%>.

Now the house <S%H1004><s%> was full <S%H4390><s%> of men <S%H582><s%> and women <S%H802><s%>; and all the lords <S%H5633><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> were there <S%H1406><s%>; and there were upon the roof about three <S%H7969><s%> thousand <S%H505><s%> men <S%H376><s%> and women <S%H802><s%>, that looked <S%H7200><s%> while Samson <S%H8123><s%> made sport <S%H7832><s%>.

And Samson <S%H8123><s%> called <S%H7121><s%> unto the Lord <S%H3068><s%>, and said <S%H559><s%>, O Lord <S%H136><s%> God <S%H3069><s%>, remember <S%H2142><s%> me <S%H2388><s%>, I pray you, and strengthen me <S%H6471><s%>, I pray you, only this once, O God <S%H430><s%>, that I may be at once <S%H259><s%> avenged <S%H5358><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> for my two <S%H8147><s%> eyes <S%H5869><s%>.

And Samson <S%H8123><s%> took hold <S%H3943><s%> of the two <S%H8147><s%> middle <S%H8432><s%> pillars <S%H5982><s%> upon which the house <S%H1004><s%> stood <S%H3559><s%>, and on which it was borne up <S%H5564><s%>, of the one <S%H259><s%> with his right hand <S%H3225><s%>, and of the other <S%H259><s%> with his left <S%H8040><s%>.

And Samson <S%H8123><s%> said <S%H559><s%>, Let me die <S%H4191><s%> with the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>. And he bowed <S%H5186><s%> himself with all his might <S%H3581><s%>; and the house <S%H1004><s%> fell <S%H5307><s%> upon the lords <S%H5633><s%>, and upon all the people <S%H5971><s%> that were in it <S%H4191><s%>. So the dead which he killed <S%H4191><s%> at his death <S%H4194><s%> were more <S%H7227><s%> than they which he killed <S%H4191><s%> in his life <S%H2416><s%>.

Then his brothers <S%H251><s%> and all the house <S%H1004><s%> of his father <S%H1><s%> came down <S%H3381><s%>, and took <S%H5375><s%> him <S%H5927><s%>, and brought him up, and buried <S%H6912><s%> him between Zorah <S%H6881><s%> and Eshtaol <S%H847><s%> in the buryingplace <S%H6913><s%> of Manoah <S%H4495><s%> his father <S%H1><s%>. And he judged <S%H8199><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> twenty <S%H6242><s%> years <S%H8141><s%>.
